TopicTitle: Huge Millenium Falcon with partial interior.

Articles.Content:
My biggest build so far,

the Millenium Falcon.

With a part count of 1685 it makes my pc run an EVA near it at 7 frames per second.

Download link: http://www./view/dx7covll5v9w485/Millenium_Falcon.craft

I didn't add any cargo boxes/benches/chess bords/hyperdrives because I didn't want to make sure this craft could only be loaded and flown by computers like the Large Pixel Collider (http://lpc.pcgamer.com/).

When you launch the vehicle, hyperedit it into space ASAP, or your KSP may crash. If you want to modify things, go ahead but prepare crashes (I can now tell from experience that it is not funny to re-do entire rooms). This monster does have working engines but I can't imagine this thing being anywhere near flyable.

Use the turret to enter the ship, first person EVA is recommended.

(http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/67695-WIP-Through-the-Eyes-of-a-Kerbal-0-0-2c-2-16-14-1st-person-EVA%28Now-toggleable%21%29)

Please let me know what you think and enjoy.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Some updates may follow, slowly detailing the exterior and maybe interior a little more.
You should make use of the welding mod
I wanted it to be full stock.

Goodness... This is HUGE! Amazing!

Btw, your rig mustn't be that bad if it runs at 7 fps at this part count...

I second the assertion that you have a beast computer. Mine runs at 7 fps with much simpler ships.

Also, it looks kind of like a derelict shipwreck with no interior lighting. You do plan to stick some lights in there, right?
Yeah, I will also try to include some more details all-around. It is a shame that the lights are all so brigt. Would turning down the r:b:y on the lights to 50:50:50 help with that?
Heck, turn them down to 10/10/10 if you need to.
